Name: Requiring the department of consumer and worker protection to implement an outreach and education campaign regarding the Temporary Schedule Change Act.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of consumer and worker protection to implement an outreach and education campaign regarding the Temporary Schedule Change Act
BodyName: Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

History.Description: This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm

History.Description: This Introduction was Amended by Committee

History.Description: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
History.BodyName: Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - November 22, 2022

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Consumer and Worker Protection to conduct an ongoing outreach and education campaign on the Temporary Schedule Change Act. The outreach and education campaign would require employers to distribute written and electronic materials created by the department to their employees.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subchapter 6 of chapter 12 of title 20 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 20-1264 to read as follows:
      � 20-1264 Outreach and Education. a. The commissioner shall conduct an ongoing outreach and education campaign about the provisions of this subchapter. 
      1. Such outreach and education shall be provided to employers, employees and members of the public who are likely to be affected by this law.
      2. The department shall develop and distribute to employers written and electronic materials containing information related to this subchapter. 
      3. Employers shall distribute written and electronic materials created by the department directly to their employees in both electronic and print format. 
      b. The materials required by this section shall be made available in English and the designated citywide languages as provided in section 23-1101. 
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.

\ul\'a7 20-1264 Outreach and Education. a. The commissioner shall conduct an ongoing outreach and education campaign about the provisions of this subchapter. \par
1. Such outreach and education shall be provided to employers, employees and members of the public who are likely to be affected by this law.\par
2. The department shall develop and distribute to employers written and electronic materials containing information related to this subchapter. \par
3. Employers shall distribute written and electronic materials created by the department directly to their employees in both electronic and print format. \par
b. The materials required by this section shall be made available in English and the designated citywide languages as provided in section 23-1101. \par
